website_summaries.verdict: A highly affordable lighter duty planer with features you would only expect in higher priced models.
pros: This unit offers an impressive 34,000 cuts per minute and features 16 stops for precision cuts of up to 1/8-inch deep
The dust collector bag can attach to either the right or left-hand side of the machine for convenience and it has a kick stand to help protect the blade
cons: Before using, take a moment to be sure the blade is adjusted properly so there are no surprises

customer_reviews.title: FANTASTIC!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: It did a fantastic job on wood that is over 200 years old! See picture!!! Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Crazymama

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding product
customer_reviews.text: Removes wood like lightning. Was indespensible in the building of my 15 foot wooden boat...lot's of planning.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed!
customer_reviews.text: I made a work bench top from cheap boards. This planer cut 1/8 inch swaths with no problem. It was way faster than I expected! It made the finer cuts with ease. The tiny dust bag filled in about 10 seconds and chips went everywhere so I will never use it again without a dust extractor set up, but I'm happy otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: J Street

customer_reviews.title: Let it cool and blow out the motor and it's back to ...
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed with product , I have put this thing through 2 days of continue uses and it goes strong, only issue is it wants to die sometimes guess because of non stop uses. Let it cool and blow out the motor and it's back to the grind. Also creates a lot of good saw dust. Would give 5 stars but can't due to the cutting out.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Well, Well, Well
customer_reviews.text: This is a GREAT tool. I received it today and am learning how to use it. I’m a beginner at wood-working; but I’ve hand-sanded many pieces. This awesome gadget is a splendid assistant and prevents a lot of arm-weariness. I’m glad that I decided to order it. Thanks to the WEN production team for this price-wise, but very useful, planer
customer_reviews.author: W. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: OUTSTANDING TOOL FOR THE MONEY!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I was in a pinch and needed to plane 5/16th's off of 80 ft of 2x8's. This means that I had to make three passes for the width, and 3 passes to plane the boards. I need to admit, I was very worried that I was going to burn up the tool or belt due to the amount that needed planed and the short amount of time that I had to do it. I am completely blown away! This planer is outstanding! I threw everything I could at it, and it took it like a champ! This is a very well-built planer, and Wen has earned my faith in low-cost outstanding tools!
customer_reviews.author: G B

customer_reviews.title: Well priced, well built power planer
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Wen 6 amp hand planer because of its shape, low price, and high ratings. Ergonomics, maneuverability and ease of use didn't matter because I built it into a poor man's jointer. It cuts smoothly and reliably. When hooked up to a decent vacuum, practically no shavings or dust escape. If I ever need to use it freehand I can remove it from the jointer frame in about 5 minutes. I don't see any reason why this planer wouldn't produce excellent results freehand. I'll update my review when I've had an occasion to use it that way.
customer_reviews.author: RPV Lee

customer_reviews.title: Impressive planer, it is.
customer_reviews.text: I bought a lot of rough cut Poplar to make new kitchen cabinet doors with. The price on the lumber was great, but it was quite rough. I decided I would plane one edge of every piece of lumber and use a table saw to process it all to proper dimension. The planed edge would be the edge I place up against the table saw fence to ensure I'm getting straight pieces of wood. It was the first time using this electric planer and I was very impressed. Sharp blades and adequate motor make it work great. My dust collection system wouldn't stay put on the plane, so I used some gorilla tape to hold it on during the planing.
customer_reviews.author: J. Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Great unit for stud walls!
customer_reviews.text: Used this to straight up some bowed 2x4s on a double sided finish wall. They were not so bad I needed to crack them, but was also not perfect and I am OCD with that stuff. Used this on about 5 boards in about 30 seconds, they were perfect and the drywall fit exact. By not cracking them I have a stronger stud as well. I did have to crack a few others though, you can't get good lumber anymore these days. Build quality was ok, but def plastic and kind of dinky, but cut smooth as butter!! For the price is was great and I will use this anytime I frame and need it.
customer_reviews.author: T. Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Simple to use, great quality for price point
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Wen product now and I'm again impressed with the quality and features. I read the instruction manual and checked the blade alignment as noted but did not need to make any adjustments. Item arrived ready to go straight out of the box. The accessories are useful and nice that they are included. The dust collection bag fills up immediately but I was pleasantly surprised that my Rigid shop Vac plugged directly into the dust port without an adaptor! This is a great quality product and performs far beyond its price tag. WEN is officially my go-to budget brand for occasional use tools. Way better than the green or grey budget brands.
customer_reviews.author: Terassic

customer_reviews.title: For the money you pay
customer_reviews.text: With this price point you do not expect to receive a top notch tool. That being said the dust bag is worthless. The depth control is your forward control/pressure control handle that does not lock at the depth that you set and can be changed with a rotation motion of your hand while you are cutting. Very dangerous not to mention your cut will fluctuate if you turn it while cutting .
customer_reviews.author: TA

customer_reviews.title: Great planer for DIY projects.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this planer specifically to plane the top of our bathroom door that would not fully close after a pipe leak in the ceiling had caused the door frame to slightly warp which prevented the door from closing. After not being able to locate a carpenter to possible replace the top of the door frame, I decided to plane the top of the door myself so it would close. This Wen planer accomplished what I needed very quickly. A few passes on the top of the door- without removing the door- and it now closes no problem. A great DIY project with the Wen and at a very reasonable price. Good quality to do smaller jobs like this one.
customer_reviews.author: C.F.

customer_reviews.title: Had to return it because the front plate is not ...
customer_reviews.text: Had to return it because the front plate is not level with the back plate. What I mean is, the left side cut deeper than the right. There is no way to adjust that and I ended up with uneven cuts on everything. Debating whether I should try another one.
customer_reviews.author: Michi

customer_reviews.title: Damaged blade on new planer. BUT, a fine tool
customer_reviews.text: I own multiple wen products and really like them. I just received this from prime delivery. And when I took it out of the box for inspection. Everything looks good with the exception one of the blades is chipped off on the left side of the blade. So I have to replace the blade on a brand new never used tool. So, with a new set of blades. I’ve used this plane and I love it! It’s my first one so I can’t compare it to other models. But I think it has performed very well. I’ve used it on two projects. Leveling my homes deck frame and making a set of wood 1-1/4”x1-1/4” poles for a tool stand cart.
customer_reviews.author: Car artist

customer_reviews.title: Set this tool up before use!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: The planer works good and runs smooth, HOWEVER, absolutely do NOT just jump into planing without checking blade height and making sure the blades are sitting even. Make sure to set this tool up. Watch a youtube video, do what you need to do, but get it set up right before using it on something you have been working on. Luckily i was testing on a scrap piece of wood but it marred it to death. One of the sides of one of the blades was angled down way low and just cut valleys on every pass. Overall though, the planer is powerful, smooth running and gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Garth

customer_reviews.title: Very good material and build quality and works very well.
customer_reviews.text: Very good material and build quality and works very well. I am very pleased with this purchase and really have no cons to report thus far, having used it quite a bit since getting it. The only word of caution is that, as with most power tools, this tool can be very dangerous if not handled carefully, The blade is extremely sharp and spins at very high speed and can do severe harm/damage even while the blade is spooling down after the trigger is released. I will definitely be getting more Wen products!
customer_reviews.author: Eaton Hubbard

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, very cost effective
customer_reviews.text: At the expense of $42, I certainly will not have the expectation for a $200 tool. However, in terms of the easiness and convenience of the operation, I love this light weight planet over the newest $170 Bosh planer. This tool works very well right out of the box. As what other reviews have indicated that the adjustment knob might slip away from the depth mark which you set up during the operation, my experience is it always slip to the lower depth(with my left hand hold the knob, right hand hold the push-handle), so it’s no big deal because it just let me go through extra a few passes, not causing any damage of over planning.
customer_reviews.author: ordinary people

customer_reviews.title: Blades are too long to make cuts with a guide
customer_reviews.text: This planer has been one of the worst items I've bought on Amazon. I knew it was cheap but figured it would be good for some simple, small cuts. The problem blade extends beyond the side of bottom so you can't run the planer along a guide to make an exact cut. For this reason it is worthless. The blades are too wide so they can not be repositioned to make this sort of cut. When removing the blade it is difficult if not impossible to get another put in. This isn't worth however little money they are charging for it.
customer_reviews.author: Nock

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: We own a custom wood farmhouse furniture business & I got this for my Husband for Fathers Day so he could make our orders even better and he loves it.. I do have to say, he very careful though. He did cut the tip of his finger off with it so be careful. It’s a great tool though.
customer_reviews.author: Ashlee

customer_reviews.title: It's ok for small hobby projects
customer_reviews.text: I use it for a small hobby projects around the house and so far so good. What I don't like about it is the little bag that supposedly catches the wood shavings. Well, first off it is too small. It fills up in the first 20 seconds and then the shavings start flying everywhere. Not very smart design. It's always a mess when I use it, but other than that i does the job.
customer_reviews.author: MTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: I was expecting it to operate like a traditional hand plane
customer_reviews.text: I was expecting it to operate like a traditional hand plane, which will remove material from anywhere on a surface. This works more like a jointer, where you have to feed starting from the edge of the workpiece. Depth is set by retracting the leading shoe plate, not by extending the blades below the base.
customer_reviews.author: Phred Phish

customer_reviews.title: The best planer investment you can make!
customer_reviews.text: I have only used this a few times so far but it has done wonders in terms of planing wood. It is much cheaper than any other electronic planer but the quality doesn't drop off. I haven't had to change the blades yet, when that happens I will give an update. It increases the depth so slightly that you can get whatever depth you want. I needed a planer but didn't want to pay a fortune, this planer had great reviews, and it even had great reviews on Home Depot's site. They were the same price at each location but amazon would ship it to me faster. I am pleased with this planer.
customer_reviews.author: KAnd

customer_reviews.title: Decent Planer
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to shave down a door a 1/4 inch. It worked great, I did 2 passes at 1/8. The price was about the same as a contractor grade Stanley block plane and just a bit more than a good Diablo saw blade for my skill saw. I don't expect this planer will actually do a good job making square or chamfer any edges. We shall see... I gave it 4 stars because its a solid tool for beginners/weekend warriors looking to get a job done. If you want to make furniture or are a carpenter I would look for a better planer.
customer_reviews.author: DanJ

customer_reviews.title: First one died quickly
customer_reviews.text: First one died in less than an hour, Amazon replaced it and the second has about an hour's worth of runtime so far. Plenty of power for palette wood. Adjustments work well and stay in place. Takes practice! Don't think you're going to create a perfect level surface on a tabletop with this, it will have to have the ridges sanded out. Three only operational problem I've noticed is that the waste chute clogs easily. Biggest problem is Amazon has charged me for the returned one, despite tracking showing it delivered.
customer_reviews.author: TheCADman99

customer_reviews.title: Great value for light work
customer_reviews.text: This planer was significantly cheaper than other brands and had some negative reviews. I had a few smaller areas I needed to plane. It worked perfectly, easy to adjust the depth of the plane and with a supplied bag to collect the waste. I only had to use if half a dozen times and I saw no issues. I've no idea if it would last for planing a large area but for a little home DIY it was perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Texas Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Replaced a door in my home that was 29.75 inches. Went to Home Depot and Lowe’s and found that the standard doors were 28 and 30 inches so I bought the 30 inch and needed to shave off .25 inches. This worked great! I am a 25 year old female and this was my very first time using a planer. It took me a around 30 mins to complete the job, including stopping to dump the wood shavings out of the bag. You simply glide the planer back and forth until you reach your desired dimensions and it was a breeze. Would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: CC

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't buy again
customer_reviews.text: Perhaps it's my inexperience in woodworking that's at fault, but I did not find this easy to use, nor did it leave a flat, level surface. You also must be very careful not to set it to take off very much, and if the pressure you apply isn't exactly even from start to finish, you'll gouge the wood.
customer_reviews.author: Cece

customer_reviews.title: Uh-maze-ing
customer_reviews.text: for the price and for the first time me ever using a planer before this was great. I did gouge the wood just a bit but got it to the right setting and then it was super easy. Like the other reviews say. This creates a TON of shavings it was everywhere. I recommend covering everything and will try hooking it up to a shop vac next time. I would definitely recommend this to people looking for an entry level planer :)
customer_reviews.author: Kellykag33

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price and small projects
customer_reviews.text: I like how efficient it is for the price but after using it couple of times I figured out I should have gone for a cordless one. The cord comes in between every now and then and when you have to lift it up it doesnt give that same smooth finish. But again, that is what I paid for. Also, sometimes the button for some reason doesn't seem like working efficiently. I will follow up on that.
customer_reviews.author: Sunny Archer

customer_reviews.title: It works good but keep in the mind that the biggest thing ...
customer_reviews.text: Idk what to really expect when i bought this tool. It works good but keep in the mind that the biggest thing you can plane is the width of the planner and what I mean is don't plan on planeing a 4 inch board bc it will never match up. It's my mistake but just a heads up. Also the catch bag is kinda a joke. I took it off right away bc it was full in minutes and a pain to empty out.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: I bought a solid-core door to replace a hollow-core door, but the new one is 1/4" too wide. I bought this to trim the door, although I have not used it for that. Mom's house came with rough-cut exterior trim. I repainted the house eleven years ago, but it started peeling, and with the rough surface, I cannot simply sand down the paint and apply more. The planer removed both the old paint and the rough texture, so now I can prime and paint!
customer_reviews.author: J. H. McNeil

customer_reviews.title: Good tool, great price.
customer_reviews.text: Nice handheld planer at a great price. I bought it to level out some joists on a deck build. It cut through the southern pine like butter. Note that if you're planing at anything more than the shallowest depth, the dust bag is essentially useless as it will fill up two or three feet into a pass. Hooking up a shop vac works well if you're able; otherwise just let the shavings blow out and clean them up later.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Works well, discharge could use a redesign.
customer_reviews.text: This is my first planer I watched a few you tube videos on how to use this specific planer before it arrived and it preforms as expected. Only have two dislikes. 1 the bag that catches the debris fills up Very quickly, like 1-2 passes, and its not super easy to empty. 2 the optional other discharge side hole blows Very warm/hot air and my hand is near it when I am grasping the front to use it so it gets rather warm on my hand. Other than that I have no complaints on the performance.
customer_reviews.author: Tina M Collins

customer_reviews.title: Great little hand planer but I should have gotten the widest one
customer_reviews.text: While I think this hand planer is easy to use, I should have bought the widest model as the 3 1/4 inch doesn't cleanly sweep the entire width of a 2 by 4. I was also shocked how much wood flakes this little machine shoots out when I'm smoothing out wood. I made a bench out of 2 by 4 and I had enough shavings to fill two large orange buckets you can purchase at that big box home improvement store. This little planer also makes a smoother surface than an orbital sander.
customer_reviews.author: happykat

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed...cheaper than the handyman
customer_reviews.text: Ok, I am VERY impressed. Had to plane a few doors that swelled due to moisture...handyman rate 75 per hour (go figure), and he would have charged at least three hours to make it worth his while (you know I am right)....would have slowed down the project to round out those hours. I bought this, shipped one day Prime, did the doors in an hour and painted the edge the next day. Two hours total....love Wen. My wife did the clean up and that took longer than the whole project !!!
customer_reviews.author: P. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I just used mine for the first time today and it works great! I found some slats of wood someone threw out and they were really rough so I used this on them and the wood looks amazing now! Very easy to use. Just make sure and have a shop vac handy so you can clean up afterwards. I added some pictures of what I’ve done with it. The close up picture with the planer in it is how the wood looked before I planed it and then the two boards put together with the pegs is after I used it.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Why have I not been using one of these
customer_reviews.text: Holy crap I must have been living under a rock for decades! I started building a deck and happen to run across a video about the electric hand planer. This tool made life so much easier in leveling boards with slight variances. This WEN tool worked perfectly for me. I own several other WEN power tools and I've yet to be let down. This is my "other" favorite power tool.
customer_reviews.author: Vykon

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the money
customer_reviews.text: I ordered one and burned up on first use but thankfully amazon sent me a replacement quick. My replacement worked flawlessly. I live in a house that was built it 1894 so most things in the house aren’t square anymore. This includes doors being stuck wouldn’t open or close correctly. With this plainer I was able to shave down the tops of the doors a 1/16 of a inch and all my doors open and close nicely.
customer_reviews.author: JarHead002

customer_reviews.title: Front shoe not level with the back shoe
customer_reviews.text: Hi i had a problem when i plane the front and back use to be bowed a lil ..when i plane a board...i checked the front shoe was not level. the depth adjustment know was to tight pulling the front shoe out of level,so i slacken the screw that hold the know and the shoe was level . when tightening the screw try to get it snug or the shoe will go out of level....also the depth adjustment ring was off easy fix just to level the front and back shoes an set the tring to zero and reassemble the knob with the cover...
customer_reviews.author: Red John

customer_reviews.title: Wen you just need to shave down studs, this works well.
customer_reviews.text: I used this to shave down a stud that was positioned about 3/16" off the footer to make it plumb with the adjoining studs. It took about 45 minutes. I have never used a power plane before, and the biggest struggle was holding the machine parallel with the stud. The attached collection bag is completely point as shavings go, the other attachments were also pointless. When the knives go dull, I'll probably just toss the unit, but it preformed well enough for the job described.
customer_reviews.author: Apple

customer_reviews.title: Planes with the best of them
customer_reviews.text: This planer rocks. It works so well. I can't imagine spending double the price would get you anything better. I have planed pine and ash and it just cuts right through it. Even the dust collector works great. The bag is small but it works and fills up fast. I hooked it to my Home Depot bucket vac and it pulls almost all the shavings from the planer. The depth dial is even accurate. This is a well thought out design and if you are a weekend wood shop DIYer, you should be more than satisfied with this. I am glad I finally added an electric planer to my tool collection.
customer_reviews.author: LFM from TX

customer_reviews.title: FORGET HAND PLANING
customer_reviews.text: Over time I struggled planing a door edge. That was a lot of work and appearance was not always satisfactory. A friend suggested this model planer and he couldn't had been more right. Slam Bam, in a minute a door I had been struggling with was planed nice and smooth, very professional appearance. Easy adjustments, easy handling. A great tool for your tool box.
customer_reviews.author: Prudent Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use with a smooth finish.
customer_reviews.text: The unit has a easy to use side guide, depth adjustment and toggle for dust bag. Cleans the edges up in a hurry, i am very happy with this little guy. Instead of using the slide on clip for the dust bag the fills up fast. I replaced it with two black paper clip clamps. The clamps go on and off faster and will not damage the nylon dust collection bag.
customer_reviews.author: Dean

customer_reviews.title: Nice Planner
customer_reviews.text: This Planner is a nice tool to have when working with wood. the first one I received was not cutting evenly so was returned and exchanged. Had used it for making a Desktop and a Printer Stand and is working properly. the only dislike about it was the wood chips collecting bag is too small and it filled up very fast... so have been using it without the bad.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy

customer_reviews.title: Works very well.
customer_reviews.text: I have used this probably 2-3 hours total running which is pretty long if you think about it. I have found that the finishes are not quite as smooth or satisfying as a good quality finely tuned bench planer. However, this reliably removes a great amount of product easily. And used in combination with a bench planer or a sander if finish is of importance you can do wonders. I can't imagine one of the other brand power hand planets working any better. For literally at least half the cost of others this can't be beat. I can't see myself needing another power hand planer unless I need to go cordless. For 40 bucks this can't be beat.
customer_reviews.author: Chewolsen

customer_reviews.title: Cheap planer but gets the job done.
customer_reviews.text: When I received this planer, I immediately noticed that the unit had some cracked and missing plastic, possibly due to overtightening the plastic housing. Knowing that I paid about a 1/3 of the price of a name brand tool, I wasn't too broken up about it. I've used this tool for about 50-70 hours and it still hasn't failed. The broken plastic was simply a cosmetic issue. I may have lucked out with a halfway decent unit because reading other reviews, it seems that the motor fails somewhat soon after use.
customer_reviews.author: Allan M.

customer_reviews.title: Worked fine for a while, blade bent easily
customer_reviews.text: I have used it around 20 times. The last time I used it, it somehow bent the blade on one the runs (nothing with nails or screws or knots) and made a huge gash in the piece I was working on. I tried to bent it back, but it still tears on the lowest setting. Probably going to throw it away unless I get the desire to try to fix it again.
customer_reviews.author: A. B.

customer_reviews.title: Great value.
customer_reviews.text: Great value. With a shopvac hooked up to it then you can really go. Had to take 1/2" off 10' long 2x4 and it filled up 5 gallon shopvac 3 times!! Took 6 runs at near max cut depth. The exhaust port won't fit a shopvac hose end exactly so just wrapped shopping bag around nozzle and two small pierces of duct tape to keep the nozzle in the planner exhaust port. Worked great and no leaky sawdust coming out. You'll know when to empty shopvac when you see sawdust not being sucked up automatically as you plane. Amazing how much sawdust this thing will make.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney

customer_reviews.title: Life Saver!
customer_reviews.text: This thing saved me a lot of time and a lot of extra painting (which I hate) I had just got done painting about 14 doors for our basement when after attempting to rehang the first one I realized I didn’t take into account the carpet. Not one of them would close without putting your shoulder into it. Three passes on the bottom of each one with this beauty and they are all now hanging perfectly, and the amazing part is the paint looks like it slept through the whole ordeal, not a scratch on it.
customer_reviews.author: The Meachams

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: It's very good value for the money. I had a few doors to shorten and this little tool saved me a lot of time and money. However one suggestion, the front big knob is made to hold on and also to adjust. It loses the adjustment when you try to maneuver the tool. Otherwise it does a pretty good job. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: A. Thinker

customer_reviews.title: Pass on this
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a cheap planer for some small trim jobs on a few cabinets and one door. The depth of cut dial is orange on orange. The chip bag is a joke. The dust blow vents are barely functional It is uncomfortable in the hand It stutters cuts Basically I guess you get what you pay god.
customer_reviews.author: David B

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for our application!
customer_reviews.text: We needed to plane down several 1x2's for Christmas gifts we were making. This worked like a charm. I'm happy to have it in our tool arsenal. A professional might look down on it, but for a couple of old amateurs, it was great.
customer_reviews.author: Robin C. Stafford

customer_reviews.title: Low cost beast
customer_reviews.text: I wish that that I could plane closer to inside corners and that the front handhold which is also the depth adjustment could be locked. Dust bag is worthless, this thing can make a pole of chips fast. I used it to plane sub fascia 2x6 on a project- it cuts easily and smooth. Well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Coat buying husband

customer_reviews.title: check the blade before you cut!
customer_reviews.text: I'm reluctant to give reviews usually. but my cutting edge was about a 16th of an inch off right out of the box from one side to the next, normally for the price I wouldn't gripe. but considering the instructions had no info on a remedy for the issue. it would be a big issue for some people without a understanding of adjusting tools. other than that it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin Erickson

customer_reviews.title: Great value. Cuts well. A couple annoying design flaws
customer_reviews.text: Great value. Cuts really well. Only complaint is that I wish the cutter adjustment knob was placed somewhere else. It's the knob you grab to guide the planer in the front.. so it's easy to accidentally adjust the cutter height.. kind of a dumb engineering design oversight. It's not a real breaker though. Only happened once or twice while planing a large bench base, so not too bad. Just annoying that it happens, or that you can't lock it. Also, the plastic kickstand thing that drops down in the back, gets in the way a lot. I wound up taping it up while working. Again, just annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Tim M Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: this thing goes through wood like butter. I am not a carpenter and this ...
customer_reviews.text: I never thought about buying a wood planer but recently i built an enclosure for putting my trash cans outside the huose, one of the doors was jamming, this thing goes through wood like butter. I am not a carpenter and this may not be a professional grade tool but for less than forty bucks this thing is just amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Salman Qazi

customer_reviews.title: Solid choice for a budget planer.
customer_reviews.text: Solid choice for a budget planer. I needed a planer for one particular project (trimming the top of the frame of a prehung exterior door) and every other planer was out of my budget. This worked perfect. Easy to use, nice smooth cut, and the door frame now fits perfect. Seems pretty well built. Plastic housing seems pretty sturdy, but I wouldn't throw it around. Obviously this planer would not be the choice of a full time carpenter, but for the occasional task of a weekend handyman, it's perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Wally

customer_reviews.title: i feel this is good product for reasonable money
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a professional user now, in the past did a few carpenter home works with Black n Decker Planner. For the time i used present machine i did not notice the difference. Also for home fix-it works i feel this is good product for reasonable money. If someone still hesitant on the quality of equipment - go for most expensive one and would not miss.
customer_reviews.author: Volodymyr Kovalchuk

customer_reviews.title: Nice hand planer
customer_reviews.text: Overall, a nice tool. Reversible dust port is nice but it clogs easily, often before the bag is full. If you're outside, it's usually easier to just aim the port away from you and let the dust hit the ground. The blade is frustratingly difficult to change and set up properly but in my experience that's just hand planers, not this tool specifically. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt V Pollack

customer_reviews.title: Cuts great. Really smooths out your lumber
customer_reviews.text: This thing works right out of the box. only setting required was the depth adjustment you want. Cuts great. Really smooths out your lumber. Only complaint is the dust bag. If you're planning a flat board, you're gonna fill up that bag after 20 foot pass of lumber. other than that, great product. Never heard of WEN before and was skeptical, but bought it and glad I did. But hey, before this I was buying HF tools. So I'm a bit of a gambler when it comes to tools.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: As good as rthe big planes at a much lower cost.
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this machine. My wife bought this for me as a Christmas gift and I have used it extensively in the past weeks. There was no problem in learning how to use it and apply the correct pressure and feed speed. The finish comes out extremely smooth. The machine has more than enough power to cut through hardwoods, which I was working with, pine, red oak, and hickory. I d not know how I ever did without this tool. Does the same job as the bigger and more expensive power planes at much lower cost..
customer_reviews.author: Louis Innamorato

customer_reviews.title: This planer is quite good. When it arrived we were amazed at the ...
customer_reviews.text: This planer is quite good. When it arrived we were amazed at the weight and quality for the price. I would give it 5 stars, except it has 1 slightly annoying issue. The valve that allows the shavings/dust to be flipped from side to side can start to "leak" through the side without the dust collector. This means that it sends shavings out the other end. Not a deal breaker, but a nuisance when using for quite a bit of planing.
customer_reviews.author: Kristy Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Needed this fast and it delivered!
customer_reviews.text: Bought new bi fold doors and needed to shave a bit off bottom. Saturday late afternoon and not interested in running to store. I ordered this product and it was at my house by noon on Sunday. Pulled it out of box, read directions quick and took it to the new doors. Fantastic! Cleaned up well and easy to use. Very pleased
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: Powerful little unit. I bought these to shave down solid wood doors in a building I run. It has enough power to not bog down even on something that thick. It makes a TON of shavings, so dont lose the bag. You can change which side it ejects them from which is great for tight spaces or switching between right and left handed users
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas W.

customer_reviews.title: First one defective. Second one works nicely.
customer_reviews.text: The first one I purchased was defective. I used it to plane the edge of a solid bedroom door. The planer blades were not perfectly parallel with the shoe. So it would plane at a very slight angle. I made it work by planing in both directions. However, I did return it. The second one I received seems to work fine and the blades are parallel to the shoe. It is a handy tool at a good price. Just be sure to check for Quality Control when you receive it. One star deduction for the bad one.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Still worked after clogging it up!
customer_reviews.text: This is a beast. Planed tons of walnut wood and it keeps going. I also planed some resin without issues. I did have an issue while inadvertently plain wood/resin combo that wasn't fully cured. It gunked up the internals but after clearing the blockages, this thing kept on working like before.
customer_reviews.author: Shadow eX

customer_reviews.title: a fime home handyman tool.
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice unit for the home owner handyman. It would not be appropriate for a professional. That said ,right after getting this, I planed 1/8" off of three doors in my house. It worked flawlesslly. So I my not have much more use for it because the rest of my doors fit just fine. But the cost was much less than hiring a professional to fix my doors. And now I have it for future use and loaning to friends.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Dunn

customer_reviews.title: This is such a surprise. I was expecting cheaply ...
customer_reviews.text: This is such a surprise. I was expecting cheaply made tool for that price. It's not. Plastic is very solid, all movable/usable parts are colored orange. Things engage with positive clicking sound. Depth adjustments are precise and it took of 1/4" of door bottom in few minutes. It's used as homeowner's tool so my comments don't apply to heavy duty constant work in contracting. Worth every dollar. Pity there is no case for this planer.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Useful tool! Takes a little practice
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to plane a work bench that was bought from a thrift store. I would recommend starting with the lowest setting and then progressing to the 1/64” that the manual recommends. I used it on the long grain as well as across the long grain to level multiple slabs. Not as good as a proper planer but I’m satisfied with it. Will use it on my other projects.
customer_reviews.author: Yoyo09

customer_reviews.title: Bargain price.
customer_reviews.text: Four stars because you have to consider the price. It's dirt cheap and cuts well. No idea how long it will last, but first impressions are pretty good. If you need to smooth out a few 2x4s from the big box store, this is a good tool. I've used better quality hand planes in the past and don't really see much of a difference other than I doubt if this will last long. The flip down rest at the back is cleverly designed to avoid you damaging the blades or your work piece when you put the planer down.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Ease of handling
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little device for taking off very thin layers of product. About the same as a belt sander with 50 grit paper, but without the sanding marks. As suggested by the instructions, keep the cutting depth to the smallest possible choice, and take several passes. DO NOT apply too much pressure if the planer gets caught up on a surface, or it will dig you a well-rounded and unintentional groove!
customer_reviews.author: Randal N.

customer_reviews.title: Built cheap
customer_reviews.text: I was planining a pine timber for a fireplace mantle & the plastic parts that the cutter wheel runs in melted and the cutter dropped and gouged my timber a d the ade broke. It ruined my Timber. The parts should be metal. It is made cheap. Not for very heavy plainng at all.
customer_reviews.author: Fiona Clair

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Overall very good value. Only plaint is the blades that came with it don't last. They became dull after about 30 minutes of fairly continuous use. For comparison, the pair that I replaced with were tungsten carbide and were much more durable.
customer_reviews.author: John Yu

customer_reviews.title: Great Planer
customer_reviews.text: Need something small for indoor and small craft projects. it came fast. It more than proved itself on the kitchen counter top that I made. It took no time for curls of Opxey to be flying all over the kitchen. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Vogt

customer_reviews.title: Great Plane for the money
customer_reviews.text: I've never enjoyed truing-up timbers for sill replacements more! This plane really makes rough shaping wood easy. I even used it to distress an ornamental sign-board to give it a hand-hewn look. I can't speak to how this would hold up to continuous hard use but I had no issues using it for over an our at the deeper setting. Well worth the money and a lot of fun to use!
customer_reviews.author: E. Bischoff

customer_reviews.title: I can't believe how easy this planer is to use and how many features ...
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe how easy this planer is to use and how many features it has for the price. The automatic foot, which protects the blades when resting works every time. The planer moves smoothly and handles easily. If you use the sawdust bag it comes with be prepared to clean it out a lot, it fills up very easily, so if you have a shopvac, I suggest hooking it up to that if you have a lot of planing to do.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Powerful, and as accurate as your skill can make it.
customer_reviews.text: Powerful, and as accurate as your skill can make it. Easy to use? Yes, it's a good tool, but practice on scrap wood guiding the machine with follow through at the end of cut. Make shallow cuts. If you're used to using a belt sander or a hand plane, this will make your day!
customer_reviews.author: Piet

customer_reviews.title: Wow!  Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure how this would work to shave almost a 1/4 inch off of a 2x6 to replace an obsolete sized board on my deck, but WOW! This thing performed flawlessly. It never bogged down and took off as much wood as I asked it to do with ease. My only complaint is that it would eject the shavings out perfectly one direction, but when switched to the other side, it would clog up every time. Not a big deal and I can't wait to use it again soon! The chamfer groove worked great to take off the square edges too.
customer_reviews.author: Echosmom

customer_reviews.title: Great planer for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t want to spend a lot of money but while working on my rent house I had several old wood doors that needed some minor adjustments and I had nothing to do it with so I purchased this for that sole purpose and I can tell you I am extremely pleased with it. I was able to shave enough off a door in a couple swipes that the doors now fit perfectly with minimal effort. Love this planer.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. B in OKC

customer_reviews.title: Good planer - has weird 1.35" diameter
customer_reviews.text: Good planer - has weird 1.35" diameter hose connection for vacuum so I used duct tape to fit a 1.25" male hose into it and it works well. NO clue why they choose some weird 1.35". duct tape is the best now all the chips go to the cyclone then vacuum!
customer_reviews.author: Travis B Klein

customer_reviews.title: Power planer
customer_reviews.text: Wow what a great inexpensive power planer...great for residential use, i planed and fitted several raised panel doors in no time at all. great little features such as a lever to change allow chips to exit right or left. It has a guide, chip collector and dado guide as well. for the money its a great home planer.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Great for the Price.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Good quality machine. It is rather large and heavy duty, thus it is a little hard to keep it perfectly parallel to the work product. But that is more user error than the machine. Highly Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Russ

customer_reviews.title: WEN 6530 6-Amp Electric Hand Planer, 3-1/4-Inch - best thing since sliced bread!
customer_reviews.text: Great deal. Low cost. Unit works perfect. I will never hand plane anything again. Can't believe someone made such a useful power tool that cost less than a good hand planer, and saves you so much energy. Can take a little or a lot off of doors so simply.
customer_reviews.author: B. G. Parks

customer_reviews.title: A dann fine value
customer_reviews.text: Remember WEN. I was hesitant to buy a Chinese product even though it was an Amazon Choice. I needn't have worried. It is well made, the design useful, but my satisfaction comes from the result. It planes rough lumber to look like the finest work of a master craftsman.
customer_reviews.author: David Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Accurate and powerful
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome! Makes planing a breeze when you have a decent amount of material to remove or don't want to take the time to plane it manually. I love how precise I can get with it. I take small bites out of the board I am planing and then take 1/64" when I am about where I need to be.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: That rare combination of affordable and good.
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic planer. Durable and rugged, I even accidentally planed over a screw, which cracked the blades. The planer was totally unaffected however, and worked like new after replacing the blades. Dust collection works perfectly, although the left side port is a bit hard to fit vacuum attachments securely. The adjustment is very precise, and the accessories work just as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick D. Connors

customer_reviews.title: Yeah, it's worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Wow, what a good tool at a great price. This is an impulse buy that you will not regret even if you use it just a few times. One use saved me hours of time behind my little Stanley block plane. Reviewers indicating the unit makes a lot of shavings and fills the bag quickly are spot on. It's not worth even using the bag if you can avoid it. Otherwise, stop reading reviews and go buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Lathedog

customer_reviews.title: Awesome CHEAP (monetarily) tool
customer_reviews.text: Awesome CHEAP (monetarily) tool. I bought this for a few jobs working on some beams and posts and it does an amazing job. I didn't want to break the bank on some of the more expensive brands and I'm glad I didn't. I'm considering getting more WEN products even though I normally shy away from the "cheaper" brands of anything as I don't like replacing entire units (rather than just a few parts).
customer_reviews.author: S. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Decent planer, loose and non-squared blades out of the box
customer_reviews.text: For the price it’s just ok. On the third use the blades were apparently loose. They also did not seem square straight out of the box. Since the blade came loose it hit the wall where it rotates and bent the blade. Had to disassemble it halfway to get it out. You get what you pay for, so if you want a cheap planer be prepared for some issues, but gets the job done eventually.
customer_reviews.author: Zach Richmond

customer_reviews.title: Great Value and Works amazing
customer_reviews.text: I'm seriously impressed with the quality and how well this planer works. For the money you'd spend on a dewalt or other name brand you can buy a couple of these. Just re surfaced a big oak sign for my house and it worked flawlessly. Not a sign of bogging down or a malfunction.
customer_reviews.author: J. Palazzo Jr.

customer_reviews.title: For $30-ish If you Need it - Get it.
customer_reviews.text: For around $30 - this is almost a throw-away. I had a couple of tough outdoor things I needed to plane down and didn't want to wreck a "good" tool - well this did the job and then some. Don't get me wrong - it's not a Festool power-plane - but for zipping down a door or other basic tasks it works exactly as well as an old Craftsman (Sears) I paid 4x as much for.
customer_reviews.author: Moo

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed!
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed! This is my second experience using a hand held planer. The first was the heavy duty model from Harbor Freight, and was returned pretty quickly as the blades would not stay put and ended up travelling into the tool itself. I was not about to miss my opportunity to return it. Fast forward to the purchase of the Wen 6530. This is a very capable tool, removes tons of material very quickly, and operates very nicely. Could feel a little more solid, but gets the job done cheaply and efficiently.
customer_reviews.author: M. Cameron

customer_reviews.title: Nice Tool For The Non professional
customer_reviews.text: Great for hanging A door it is mostly plastic so it is easy to use and has plenty of power. The coarse adjustment work well . I like that the chips fly in either direction with the flip switch. Don't get me wrong it is a plastic P.O.S. but It will do the job. and if you are a Do it yourself home owner and don't want to invest in real Power Tools that cost $300 this thing is Great dislikes It is fairly large , the Catch Bag Is a joke Hook up a vacuum. It would be nice if there was a cary bag or storage container
customer_reviews.author: Fox Auto

customer_reviews.title: Quality tool for low price
customer_reviews.text: I have an old 1/2 inch WEN drill works great takes a beating and keeps on going. So I am trying the planer works great more power than some others cheap ones I have tried and failed B&D. Has the same power as my Hitachi for a lot less...
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the modest price for occasional use.
customer_reviews.text: Since I don't use a planar very often, this is perfect for me. Well made, does the job. If you're going to use one everyday a more expensive model may be warranted, but I think this is fine for the average homeowner.
customer_reviews.author: Beethoven Fanatic

customer_reviews.title: This thing it amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing, it works very well and holds up on some hard tests. At the price point you cannot go wrong with this unit. If there are any negatives you could say the bag that collects the wood chips is very cheap and is unraveling already.
customer_reviews.author: Tanner

customer_reviews.title: Same as the competition. Same Factory.
customer_reviews.text: This WEN is made under different BRANDS. If you look at the comparison photos on an image search you'll see what I mean. Do your due diligence. One thing is for sure, I bought this at far less than the identical twin. Have fun planing. It works just fine for me.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Thomas

customer_reviews.title: cuts uneven
customer_reviews.text: I know this has a lot of good reviews and maybe I got a dud or its not adjusted right but it was leaving 1/8 to 1/4 difference in place I planed, sometimes it would stick as i was pushing it and dig deep into the wood
customer_reviews.author: jeff tucker

customer_reviews.title: Excellent heavy duty tool.
customer_reviews.text: To install new doors it was necessary to trim down the standard size door slabs to exactly fit my existing door openings. I had never done this before with an electric planer and the WEN tool was so easy to master. I really like the adjustable cutting depth. I could take relatively deep cuts (1/8" inch) down to just barely shaving the surface to fine tune the cutting depth.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Dopson

customer_reviews.title: I contacted Wen's technical support and though not necessarily easy to work with they did send a replacement cover
customer_reviews.text: It works as its supposed to but mine arrive with a cracked case. I contacted Wen's technical support and though not necessarily easy to work with they did send a replacement cover.
customer_reviews.author: D.S.

product_meta.title: WEN 6530 6-Amp Electric Hand Planer, 3-1/4-Inch
product_meta.description: Size:3-1/4 Inch| Style:PlanerRemember when you needed to smooth out those joists? Plane away chips, splinters and misshapen edges with the WEN 6 Amp 3-1/4 Inch Electric Hand Planer. Perfect for fixing stubborn doors and fitting wood. This power planer’s 6-Amp motor delivers over 34,000 cuts per minute to your workpiece, slicing away any irregularities until the surface of your boards are aligned and smooth. With a cutting width of 3-1/4 inches and a maximum cutting depth of 1/8 inch, you’ll have the perfect companion for fitting and squaring boards. The 16 positive stops increase in increments of 1/128 inch anywhere from 0 all the way up to 1/8 inches. The base plate shoe even includes a v-shaped groove for easily flattening sharp post corners. Aside from the power planer, this package also includes a dust bag, a rabbeting guide, a kickstand and a parallel fence bracket. The included rabbeting guide adjusts anywhere from 0 to 7/10 inches to allow for rabbets up to an inch deep in size. The parallel fence provides an accurate and straight cut by making sure your strokes are directly parallel to the edge of the wood (a must have for planing door edges, wood trim and boards). The kickstand protects both the blade and the workpiece in between uses by keeping the blade elevated and out of contact from the surface of your project. Finally, the dust bag collects all of your loose shavings to keep your work space clean and sawdust free. The bag attaches to both the left or right hand side of the planer to fit whatever your preference may be. And because this is a WEN Product, your 6 Amp 3-1/4 Inch Electric Hand Planer comes backed by a 2-year warranty, a friendly customer help line, and a nationwide network of skilled service technicians. Remember when you had a reliable planer that lasted for years? Remember WEN.
feature_bullets: 6-amp motor provides up to 34,000 cuts per minute
16 positive stops adjust the cutting depth anywhere from 0 to 1/8 inches
Make rabbets up to 7/10 inch in size with the included rabbeting guide
Lightweight design weighs in at a mere 6 pounds. Motor:120 V, 60 Hz
Includes power planer, dust bag, a kickstand, a parallel fence bracket and a 2-year warranty

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars2,237 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
